answers.answer: A glucose tolerance test is the administration of glucose (in a gross drink) to determine how quickly it is cleared from the blood. The test is usually used to test for diabetes, insulin resistance, and sometimes reactive hypoglycemia. The glucose is most often given orally so the common test is technically an oral glucose tolerance test.....probably a pretty good idea to get it done
